author: Katie Mansfield
title: Five people in hospital after car ploughs into pedestrians in South London | UK | News | Express.co.uk
text:
BREAKING: Five people in hospital after car ploughs into pedestrians in London BREAKING: Five people in hospital after car ploughs into pedestrians in London FIVE people have been rushed to hospital after a car ploughed into a crowd of pedestrians in south London. PUBLISHED: 10:48, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 | UPDATED: 10:49, Sun, Feb 26, 2017 
The car left the road and crashed into a wall near Catford Bus Garage in Bellingham this morning. 
It is unclear how seriously injured the pedestrians are. 
A Met Police spokesman said: “Police were called at approximately 8.20am on Sunday, 26 February, to reports of a car in collision with a wall and a number of pedestrians on Bromley Road in Bellingham. 
“Officers, the London Ambulance Service and London’s Air Ambulance are in attendance. 
“Five people were treated at the scene. They have all been taken to south and east London hospitals. 
“We await an update on their condition.” 
Traffic has come to a standstill in the area as police remain at the scene. 
More to follow…
